result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary M. Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 1, Ct 2 and Ct 3 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  If restitution is not paid by 09/15/2016, the defendant is sentenced to an additional 60 days in jail, which will begin 09/15/2016 no later than 6:00 pm.
Fees surcharges and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant is to remain employed, if not he is to do job searches as instructed by his agent, reporting them to his agent.  If employed, defendant to report employment information to his agent within 48 hours.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Defendant can apply for early discharge after one year and if the restitution is paid in full.

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence is on Ct 1 only.  Defendant to commence his sentence on or before 01/02/2015, no later than 6:00 p.m.  Huber granted.  Defendant may serve his sentence in Eau Claire County. Privilege of transfer is denied if it results in electronic monitoring.

This is a stayed sentence, to be served consecutively to the 30 day sentence only if the defendant does not pay his restitution in full by 09/15/2016.  If paid the 60 days does not have to be served.  If not paid, the jail sentence will begin  09/15/2016 no later than 6:00 pm, with Huber.  The defendant may serve his sentence in Eau Claire County, privilege of transfer is denied if it results in electronic monitoring.
